intro: Exochaenium platypterum, commonly known as the flat-winged grass, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of central and southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and narrow, flat leaves that help reduce water loss in dry environments. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet, which is often concealed within the leaf sheaths. Exochaenium platypterum plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat and is adapted to survive in low-nutrient, drought-prone soils.
